Package arcade.core.agent.process

Interface Process

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PatchProcess, PatchProcessInflammation, PatchProcessMetabolism, PatchProcessMetabolismCART, PatchProcessMetabolismComplex, PatchProcessMetabolismMedium, PatchProcessMetabolismRandom, PatchProcessMetabolismSimple, PatchProcessSignaling, PatchProcessSignalingComplex, PatchProcessSignalingMedium, PatchProcessSignalingRandom, PatchProcessSignalingSimple
    public interface Process
    A Process object is a non-exclusive subcellular steppable.

    Process objects represent subcellular behaviors or mechanisms within a Cell object, such as metabolism, signaling networks, and angiogenesis. The Process should be called during the step method of the corresponding Cell object. A Process can be implemented with different versions; the specific class can be selected when instantiating the Cell object.

    More than one Process can be active for a given Cell object. Use Module for exclusive steppables.

    Process objects are analogs to Operation for steppables that affect cells.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void step​(ec.util.MersenneTwisterFast random, Simulation sim)
      Performs the actions of the process during the Cell step.
